revised_title: Theoretical Chemistry of Superheavy Elements: Atomic Structure and Ionization Potentials
tldr: The authors used the multi-configuration Dirac-Fock method to study the atomic structure and ionization potentials of neutral atoms and ions in the 7p series of superheavy elements. Their findings provide data for predicting the chemical properties of these elements, which may have different bonding characteristics compared to those found in the familiar part of the Periodic Table.
